channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Economic Dangers Is the Bond Market Pricing In?
item.description: Even more so than stocks, bonds are often seen as an economic bellwether.

item.title: E.l.f. Beauty sales jump 50% on gains in color cosmetics and skin care, launch of Bronzing Drops serum
item.description: E.l.f. Beauty has won over younger consumers with its viral marketing and low-priced "dupes" of prestige favorites.

item.title: The Score: Apple, Walt Disney, Eli Lilly and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: Paramount Global announces it will cut 15% of U.S. workforce, shares rise on second-quarter earnings
item.description: Paramount Global plans to cut 15% of its U.S. workforce as part of a broader $500 million cost reduction.

item.title: Wall Street Ends Wild Week in a Surprising Place
item.description: Inflation data next week could lead to more big stock swings, but corporate earnings have remained mostly upbeat.

item.title: Under Armour shares surge 20% after posting 'better than feared' quarterly sales
item.description: Under Armour is in the midst of a broad restructuring as the company contends with a sales slowdown and a revolving door of leaders.

item.title: Activist Starboard Value Takes Stake in Starbucks
item.description: Another activist hedge fund, Elliott Investment Management, is already agitating for changes at the coffee giant.

item.title: Eli Lilly blows past estimates, hikes guidance as Zepbound, Mounjaro sales soar
item.description: The success of Eli Lilly's weight loss and diabetes drugs Zepbound and Mounjaro caused the company to hike its guidance.

item.title: How to Stay Sane When Markets Get Wild
item.description: Market strategists and online pundits always have explanations for stock-market volatility. That doesn’t mean you have to believe them.

item.title: Eli Lilly's blowout quarter should quiet investor concerns about the stock
item.description: Shares of the drugmaker jumped about 8% in Thursday trading after easily beating earnings expectations.
